status.progress: REQUIRED: The state of the data set.
status.update: REQUIRED: The frequency with which changes and additions are made to the data set after the initial data set is completed.

idinfo.accconst: REQUIRED: Restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing the data set.
idinfo.useconst: REQUIRED: Restrictions and legal prerequisites for using the data set after access is granted.

dataIdInfo.idPurp: Watersheds - Surface Water Hydrologic Unit Boundary Polygons for the 8 major Hawaiian islands. Source: State of Hawaii, Department of Land and Natural Resources, Commission on Water Resource Management. Created as part of a partial update to the Water Resource Protection Plan (2008). Original layer created for the Office of Planning: State Definition and Delineation of Watersheds, prepared by GDSI, 1995. Update, 1999: Refinement of Hawaii Watershed Delineations, USDA Natural Resources Conservation Service, GDSI. Update by CWRM, 2008: Derived from the watershed layers created and updated by GDSI for the Office of State Planning and the Natural Resources Conservation Service (see below). The GDSI layer was updated by CWRM and Office of State Planning staff in 2008 using water diversion points submitted by water use declarants and stream diversion work permit applicants, as well as CWRM staff visual review. For additional information, please refer to complete metadata at http://files.hawaii.gov/dbedt/op/gis/data/watersheds_cwrm.pdf or contact Hawaii Statewide GIS Program, Office of Planning, State of Hawaii; PO Box 2359, Honolulu, Hi. 96804; (808) 587-2846; email: gis@hawaii.gov; Website: http://planning.hawaii.gov/gis.
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Watersheds - Surface Water Hydrologic Unit Boundary Polygons for the 8 major Hawaiian islands. Source: State of Hawaii, Department of Land and Natural Resources, Commission on Water Resource Management. Created as part of a partial update to the Water Resource Protection Plan (2008).

Original layer created for the Office of Planning: State Definition and Delineation of Watersheds, prepared by GDSI, 1995. Update, 1999: Refinement of Hawaii Watershed Delineations, USDA Natural Resources Conservation Service, GDSI. Update by CWRM, 2008: Derived from the watershed layers created and updated by GDSI for the Office of State Planning and the Natural Resources Conservation Service (see below). The GDSI layer was updated by CWRM and Office of State Planning staff in 2008 using water diversion points submitted by water use declarants and stream diversion work permit applicants, as well as CWRM staff visual review. For additional information, please refer to complete metadata at http://files.hawaii.gov/dbedt/op/gis/data/watersheds_cwrm.pdf or contact Hawaii Statewide GIS Program, Office of Planning, State of Hawaii; PO Box 2359, Honolulu, Hi. 96804; (808) 587-2846; email: gis@hawaii.gov; Website: http://planning.hawaii.gov/gis.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: State of Hawaii Department of Land and Natural Resources, Commission on Water Resource Management Natural Resources Conservation Service State of Hawaii, Office of Planning, Statewide GIS Program

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntaddr.postal: REQUIRED: The ZIP or other postal code of the address.

cntinfo.cntvoice: REQUIRED: The telephone number by which individuals can speak to the organization or individual.
